intro: Flaveria chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean flaveria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Flaveria chilensis is also known for its use in ecological studies due to its rapid growth and role in soil stabilization.
